reviews.review_msg: This guy doesn't lecture, he mumbles. Super picky about details in essays and not in a good way. Really anxious lecturer, doesn't answer questions directly. Super nice guy though
Very difficult readings, but I learned a lot.

No doubt that Elena is smart and knowledgable about her subject matter. But her teaching style is not something I'd prefer. No ppts and involves only discussions. She has no direction to what is being taught, does not reply to emails and is very VERY disorganized.

Horrible class structure! She is clearly very educated on the topic but does not teach instead wants students to regurgitate articles the whole class. Do not know what we pay tuition for when the professor does not teach, if we wanted to listen to fellow students for three hours we would not need professors!

Does not tech! Her teaching stye is not very organized she lectures for a short time maybe an hour then its up to students to ramble on about articles for two hours everyclass!The class is not difficult but its more like you are teaching yourself the material because she does not so she forces students to summarize articles every class. Painful!

Widely considered one of the best sessional instructors at SFU for a reason. Quirky & technologically impaired but smart, extremely dedicated, knowledgeable and thorough in everything she does. Great lectures, has a unique way of imparting valuable info and a logical grading scheme. Put in the work and get the grades you deserve. Loved her class.

Brenda is the best Poli Sci prof at SFU. Sometimes the material can get boring and her lectures are very dense, but very informative, exams are based on the readings. The essay asks you to use theory from the class to analyze a case, and she marks based on your understanding not your writing skills. Take good notes and you will do well

Brenda does not have powerpoints, but delivers her lectures in a way that you get the info you need for the papertests. While the readings are important, she essentially tells you what they are about, therefore actually reading the readings is not necessary. She also gives you the essay Q for the midterm and final, which is worth 70% of the test.

She's really kind and leads her students to do the best works they can. Her class would be really hard without a hard effort. However, when she marks essays, she focuses on the contents of the essay rather than how the essay is bullshted. Well, she would like to see how the ideas are clearly presented on the essay, but she enjoys to see your ideas

Great lecturer. Provides lots of examples and tries to engage the students. Very helpful with essays, even makes extra office hours to accommodate everyone. Don't be fooled though. When she says you have a choice of questions, you still really need to know everything because of the way she designs the exams.
Best Prof. in PoliScie department.

Brenda is BRILLIANT! She is one of the best profs I've had to date. She really cares for her students and values their opinions/ideas. She is very clear in the way she teaches and very fair marker. Highly recommend taking her classes!

Brenda is a great professor. She explains the class material well, there are no surprises on exams. The class was interesting and informative, with a good reading list. Be prepared to work for a good grade.

Great prof. Lectures are clear and interesting. Goes out of her way to help students. but u have to be willing to do the work. Some readings are hard but if u go to class she explains them really well. Also encourages questions and discussion.
A lot of reading but a good class and a committed instructor
Kanya is an amazing professor. She's really interesting and does a great job keeping everyone engaged. Also she's very easy on the eyes
I LOVE KANYA. SHE SO INTERESTING AND INTERESTED. VERY ENGAGED CLASS WITH LOTS OF DISCUSSION AND VIDEOS. AND SHE IS BEAUTIFUL.
I love her.  A lot of reading and a lot of hard work required but if you are passionate about the topic, it is worth the effort.  Not a course for slackers!
Don't miss classes.  Fair marker but picky on grammar.
She talks most of the class but is super engaging. Take notes she will repeat what is important and that will be on the exam! She prepares her students for success!

AMAZING PROF and REALLY PRETTY! Very engaging, a fair marker, and super helpful! She changed my perspectives on many issues and i learned a lot from her. I would take her class regardless of the topic, she is clear, concise, super easy going and GREAT to listen too
All around good guy and would take more classes with him.
Steve has been the clearest professor when it comes to what is expected of you during the session. He cares about the students and the course work, I would highly recommend taking this class.

Clare is a great prof that communicates well and is passionate about what she teaches. If you're a political science student, you will love any class you take with her. Some polisci classes tend to be dull but she has always made them interesting. She speaks on her experiences which is interesting, and she is also very neutral which is rare.

Clare is incredibly kind, accessible and professional. As a political science professor, she is surprisingly neutral and really knows how to generate discussion. Would highly recommend any student who actually cares to take courses with her, as she really knows her stuff from law to politics to history.
great prof, very passionate about political science and a VERY fair marker. THE best Political Science professor I've had at SFU in 3 years.
Godbout is a fair marker and makes it clear what he expects. His lectures are pretty informative and he does a good job keeping you you awake.
Godbout's extremely funny and at times sarcastic!  His lectures were very detailed and brings a lot of examples, other forms of media, and encourages questions, definitely worthwhile!

Was a funny guy at times which I appreciate but also called students out in ways that discouraged people from participating or drawing attention to themselves, which is not cool from a prof. There is a ton of reading but is a fair marker. You have to come to every class and participate in every discussion if you want a good grade.

(Islam & the West) Funny and nice guy! Tries to make 4hr lecture more interesting w videos. Midterm was east, paper was ok, take-home exam was HARD and confusing! You have 5 (FIVE) books to read, 100+ pages each week. If you work hard you will do fine, but be prepared to spend a LOT of time on this course. You will learn something though!!

AMAZING. I can't say enough about how good and up to date his material was and his extremely weird and wonderful sense of humour. This teacher is a must if your taking any courses at SFU. Be prepared to participate, if you miss more than one class, your screwed. Be careful how you frame your questions, you definitely can't get away with saying BS.

Funny prof who teaches an interesting class on Islam. Fun movie reviews are part of the course, and debates/discussions in class are always interesting. Participate in class and do the readings; you should be fine if you do. I do feel like he expects us to read too much (~6 books), which is what we are tested on.
Logan is excellent. Yes he does not response to emails in full, but that is why you have office hours for. He will help if you show interest in the course.
Great instructor, teaching Southeast Asia. A region I did not much about. The grading was excellent.
Excellent prof. gets to the point. A very fair grader and not much work for a 3rd year level course
excellent instructor.
Logan was excellent. His knowledge about the subject matter was great. Very informal classes and gave extensions when needed. Will take a class again with him.

The Professor is clear and well spoken, easy to understand. He encourages discussion and is not boring, you just have to get used to the teaching style. No MT, Final is a combinations of Lecture notes and textbook. Paper is marked fair and presentation is not hard if your prepared. Excellent prof!

very knowledgable about asian politics. he was born and raised in singapore so he knows a lot. Just make sure you participate and do well on the presentation. the paper is standard but his teaching style is really laid back. highly recommended! This professor should be a full time prof at sfu!
great prof. if you get off on the right foot with him and participate you get a minimum A- . our 4 hour classes barley lasted 2.5 hours, really relaxed teaching style... highly recommended prof!
What a great prof.  Cares about students and I learned a lot!!!

Good luck listening to what this egghead has to say. Very unhelpful, arguable and confusing...I spent most of my time frustrated with him concerning how he wants resaerch papers and assignments done. Speaka gooda engrish aneewun???
Seems nice, but is actually quite disagreeable
If he likes you...smooth sailing! show up, do the readings and pretend to be interested if you want to do well
Excellent lecturer.  And he has a certain cuteness.
Ben like all profs has his own opinions. However if your opinion differs from his, he does not like this and will grade you harder because of it. Alot of class time was wasted doing presentation.
Tough readings, tough prof, but awesome overall

Not for the weak of heart (like the last two commentators I guess). If you're not willing to reimagine, and it might hurt, this is not for you. Not a question/answer, learn to throw the profs ideas back at him sort of class. Time to think for yourself.

Very arrogant. He's one of these professors who doesn't "get" the concept that people can have different opinions than him. From his perspective, everyone is either correct, or "naive." His non-lecture lectures are an easy and often fun format, but I didn't feel like I was getting my money's worth at all. There's such a thing as TOO casual.
I liked this professor. My first globalization class and it was excellent. Very helpful and not a hard marker provided you study he is very flexible.
Pretty fair marker, if you go to office hours he is very helpful. Wants you to work for your grade but lets you pick a topic of interest to you
He is super interesting but a bit tougher than other profs in the poli sci department.  I usually get A's easily in 3rd year poli sci classes but he made me work for mine.

Interesting lectures but he doesn't expect you to attend all the time.  He does not give a lot of feedback on essays and midterms but is always willing to talk you through assignments and give suggestions after class or at office hours.  Easy marker.

He's a good prof, he is really passionate about the topic. He goes off on tangents and anecdotes sometimes, but he makes you think and asks tough questions. I don't come to class to hear a prof recite the readings to me. The quizzes are easy if you just do the readings.

First off,  I'd like to say that Sanjay is a really nice and chill guy. I took 2 classes with him POL200 and POL339(317). However,  most lectures I had no clue what was going on because the lecture notes were so broad. For both courses, quizzes are exceptionally hard. Uses too many examples / complex ones that are hard to understand. Fair marker.
He's a great prof who is clear with expectations. Would take another class with him.
His lectures are pretty interesting and the workload is fair. If you read and go to class the quizzes are easy. He's really easy going and good at giving feedback in person.

Lectures are very boring. Slides are not detailed at all, which is hard especially since the readings are super wordy. But he is open to feedback. The quizzes are only hard when they aren't open book. The group presentation he marks very fairly. Horrible at responding to emails. But a super nice guy.
